texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Photo credit:  Marek Piwnicki
texts.text: Photo credit:  Marek Piwnicki

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Let's start this post with a quote:
texts.text: Let's start this post with a quote:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: "We are dying from overthinking. We are slowly killing ourselves by thinking about everything." -- Anthony Hopkins
texts.text: "We are dying from overthinking. We are slowly killing ourselves by thinking about everything." -- Anthony Hopkins

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: That's an accurate summary of my life on Twitter over the past few years. I lost the enjoyment from connecting with other people and suddenly found myself doom scrolling  -- looking over my Twitter feed with glossy eyes, seeing only negativity and feeling less connected to other people.
texts.text: That's an accurate summary of my life on Twitter over the past few years. I lost the enjoyment from connecting with other people and suddenly found myself doom scrolling  -- looking over my Twitter feed with glossy eyes, seeing only negativity and feeling less connected to other people.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Then I thought: "Why am I using  social  media if it makes me feel less social and less connected?"
texts.text: Then I thought: "Why am I using  social  media if it makes me feel less social and less connected?"

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Is it Twitter? Is there something wrong with the platform? Is it the same problem that people see with Facebook?
texts.text: Is it Twitter? Is there something wrong with the platform? Is it the same problem that people see with Facebook?

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Is it me?
texts.text: Is it me?

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: The problem
texts.text: The problem

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Social media companies thrive on eyeballs. More eyeballs looking at the platform for longer periods means higher ad revenue. Sure, cute and fuzzy cats or funny family videos certainly capture attention, but there's nothing like the attention you gain through spreading fear, anger, and contempt.
texts.text: Social media companies thrive on eyeballs. More eyeballs looking at the platform for longer periods means higher ad revenue. Sure, cute and fuzzy cats or funny family videos certainly capture attention, but there's nothing like the attention you gain through spreading fear, anger, and contempt.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Many argue that platforms like Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and Tiktok have algorithms that show you content that cause you to spend more time on the site. Much of the content out there is negative and that certainly drives traffic.
texts.text: Many argue that platforms like Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and Tiktok have algorithms that show you content that cause you to spend more time on the site. Much of the content out there is negative and that certainly drives traffic.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: However, the humans using the platform an interacting with each other are also responsible. Lies and misleading information spread like wildfire, especially if they disparage a group or a belief that is divisive. By the time the truth comes out, the lie has done irreparable damage.
texts.text: However, the humans using the platform an interacting with each other are also responsible. Lies and misleading information spread like wildfire, especially if they disparage a group or a belief that is divisive. By the time the truth comes out, the lie has done irreparable damage.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: In Tyler Merritt's book,  I Take My Coffee Black , he talks about divisiveness that appeared in his church and community. He writes that distance breeds contempt and distrust, but proximity brings understanding. You see this constantly on social media where people wage war over politics but then they do their best to keep quiet about it when they meet in person.
texts.text: In Tyler Merritt's book,  I Take My Coffee Black , he talks about divisiveness that appeared in his church and community. He writes that distance breeds contempt and distrust, but proximity brings understanding. You see this constantly on social media where people wage war over politics but then they do their best to keep quiet about it when they meet in person.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: My problem with Twitter
texts.text: My problem with Twitter

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I started with Twitter in 2008 and my account is just over 10,000 followers. Sure, that's a tiny fraction compared to many other accounts, but to me, that's a tremendous amount. I'm truly humbled at the amount of people who are interested in what I say and share. Thank you.
texts.text: I started with Twitter in 2008 and my account is just over 10,000 followers. Sure, that's a tiny fraction compared to many other accounts, but to me, that's a tremendous amount. I'm truly humbled at the amount of people who are interested in what I say and share. Thank you.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: On the other hand, when it came time to follow people, I felt like it was important to follow anyone who followed me. If you're going to take time to listen to what I have to say, then I should do the same. Right?
texts.text: On the other hand, when it came time to follow people, I felt like it was important to follow anyone who followed me. If you're going to take time to listen to what I have to say, then I should do the same. Right?

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: At first, this worked out well. Over time, I followed some people who shared things that I was upset about. That lead me to follow other people who reinforced my beliefs, biases, and choices. I'd run into opinions that differed from mine and I wouldn't follow those people or extend the reach of what they shared. My set of beliefs were continually reinforced.
texts.text: At first, this worked out well. Over time, I followed some people who shared things that I was upset about. That lead me to follow other people who reinforced my beliefs, biases, and choices. I'd run into opinions that differed from mine and I wouldn't follow those people or extend the reach of what they shared. My set of beliefs were continually reinforced.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Through all this time, I had really close friends who would ask: "Hey, did you see that blog post I wrote? I put it on Twitter." My response would usually be "Oh, well, I follow a lot of people and it's hard to keep up with all of that."
texts.text: Through all this time, I had really close friends who would ask: "Hey, did you see that blog post I wrote? I put it on Twitter." My response would usually be "Oh, well, I follow a lot of people and it's hard to keep up with all of that."

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: That was a cop-out. The problem was staring me straight in the face.
texts.text: That was a cop-out. The problem was staring me straight in the face.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I stopped using social media to connect with people. I was in a downward spiral of negativity that I had brought upon myself.
texts.text: I stopped using social media to connect with people. I was in a downward spiral of negativity that I had brought upon myself.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: New goals
texts.text: New goals

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Last weekend, I put up a final tweet saying I was done with Twitter for a while and provided some other contact information for anyone who wanted to reach out. I deleted Twitter from my devices, signed out on my computers, and enjoyed my weekend.
texts.text: Last weekend, I put up a final tweet saying I was done with Twitter for a while and provided some other contact information for anyone who wanted to reach out. I deleted Twitter from my devices, signed out on my computers, and enjoyed my weekend.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: That was the key.  I enjoyed my weekend.
texts.text: That was the key.  I enjoyed my weekend.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Then I thought,  "How can I enjoy next week and next weekend, too?"
texts.text: Then I thought,  "How can I enjoy next week and next weekend, too?"

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: So I set up some goals for myself with social media:
texts.text: So I set up some goals for myself with social media:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Reduce my list of people I follow to people who I truly care about. Someone
texts.text: Reduce my list of people I follow to people who I truly care about. Someone

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: If anyone I follow violates the first rule, consider removing them or
texts.text: If anyone I follow violates the first rule, consider removing them or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Find a way to filter out retweets so I can see what people are saying, not
texts.text: Find a way to filter out retweets so I can see what people are saying, not

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Keep everything else (news, financial information, etc) compartmentalized
texts.text: Keep everything else (news, financial information, etc) compartmentalized

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: The reset
texts.text: The reset

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: After my weekend off Twitter, I realized I had over 57,000 tweets (many of which violated my own first rule above) and I was following thousands of people on Twitter. Many of those people I followed were people I cared nothing about (celebrities, angry people, divisive political figures).
texts.text: After my weekend off Twitter, I realized I had over 57,000 tweets (many of which violated my own first rule above) and I was following thousands of people on Twitter. Many of those people I followed were people I cared nothing about (celebrities, angry people, divisive political figures).

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: This required some drastic action.
texts.text: This required some drastic action.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: I
texts.text: I

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: I used the
texts.text: I used the

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Deleting 57,000 tweets took several hours but the remaining bits were removed in less than an hour. The tweepy package made the process painless and it was easy to just leave running in a terminal while I worked on other things.
texts.text: Deleting 57,000 tweets took several hours but the remaining bits were removed in less than an hour. The tweepy package made the process painless and it was easy to just leave running in a terminal while I worked on other things.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Going forward
texts.text: Going forward

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: My social media goals (see above) drive my current decisions on Twitter. If I followed you before, but I don't follow you now: please don't take it personally. I'm gradually bringing people back into my feed and I'm looking at Twitter less often.
texts.text: My social media goals (see above) drive my current decisions on Twitter. If I followed you before, but I don't follow you now: please don't take it personally. I'm gradually bringing people back into my feed and I'm looking at Twitter less often.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: It might take me a little while to find you again. That's okay. 🤗
texts.text: It might take me a little while to find you again. That's okay. 🤗

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: In addition, I plan to share more real, interesting, original content and avoid the favorite and retweet buttons unless I find something incredibly valuable. I plan to avoid negativity but I will share things that make us question the norms that surround us.
texts.text: In addition, I plan to share more real, interesting, original content and avoid the favorite and retweet buttons unless I find something incredibly valuable. I plan to avoid negativity but I will share things that make us question the norms that surround us.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: After all, questioning the status quo so much of what makes us human. We know there's something better out there and we want to achieve it. We can't do it by tearing each other down, but we can surely do it by building meaningful connections between all of us.
texts.text: After all, questioning the status quo so much of what makes us human. We know there's something better out there and we want to achieve it. We can't do it by tearing each other down, but we can surely do it by building meaningful connections between all of us.
